html:
thy husband. Once again the Lord identifies himself as the husband of Israel, or the righteous (50:1; 62:5; Matt. 25:1-13; 2 Cor. 11:1-4; Rev. 19:7-9; D&C 33:17; 133:10, 19). When the Lord returns to redeem Zion, he will be as a loving and tender bridegroom coming to claim his beloved bride.

Lord of Hosts. See commentary on 1:9.

God of the whole earth. Idol worshipers felt that each of earth's many gods held jurisdiction over a limited area. But the true God rules over all. In truth, Jehovah is the God not only of the Israelites or the Latter-day Saints but of all creatures on the face of the earth (3 Ne. 11:14).
